Detailed Description

The Facade class defines the interface to the Chronicle facility.

It is not possible (or necessary) to construct a Facade instance; all of the member functions are static.

Note
You must call the initialize() member function (once) before invoking the other member functions.
Warning
When you are finished with the Facade, be sure to invoke the cleanup() member function; otherwise the facility will not be shutdown properly and resources will not be freed.

Member Function Documentation

static Error Chronicle::Facade::addObserver ( FacadeObserver *  observer)
static

Adds an observer to receive notifications from the Facade.

Warning
The collection of observers is unordered so do not make any assumption about the order in which observers will be notified.
Note
Does not take ownership of the observer instance. Has no effect if the observer is already in the collection.
Parameters
observerA pointer to an instance of a FacadeObserver subclass.
Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
removeObserver()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::canPauseCapture ( )
static

Queries whether a capture can be paused.

Useful for setting the state of UI widgets.

Returns
true if a capture is in progress (and if it is not already paused), otherwise false.
See Also
pauseCapture(), isCapturing(), isCapturePaused()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::canResumeCapture ( )
static

Queries whether a capture can be resumed.

Useful for setting the state of UI widgets.

Returns
true if a capture is in progress (and if it is paused), otherwise false.
See Also
resumeCapture(), isCapturing(), isCapturePaused()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::canStartCapture ( )
static

Queries whether a capture can be started.

Useful for setting the state of UI widgets.

Returns
true if a capture can be started (and there is no capture in progress), otherwise false.
See Also
startCapture(), isInitialized(), isCapturing()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::canStopCapture ( )
static

Queries whether a capture can be stopped.

Useful for setting the state of UI widgets.

Returns
true if a capture is in progress, otherwise false.
See Also
stopCapture(), isCapturing()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::cleanup ( )
static

Frees in-process resources used by the Chronicle facility.

If the Facade is not initialized, calling this method has no effect.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
isInitialized()
static Waypoint* Chronicle::Facade::createWaypoint ( const String &  category)
static

Creates a Waypoint instance.

Optionally add one or more attributes using Waypoint::addAttribute(). Optionally set the duration of the waypoint using Waypoint::setDuration(). The time of the waypoint is set automatically; this can be overridden using Waypoint::setTime().

For commonly-used waypoints it is usually more convenient to call the appropriate static member function(s) in the Facade::Waypoints class.

Warning
The caller assumes ownership of the waypoint until the waypoint is recording by invoking waypointReached().
Parameters
categoryThe waypoint category.
Returns
A Waypoint instance, or NULL if not successful.
static Time Chronicle::Facade::currentTime ( )
static

Returns the current time.

See Also
Waypoint::setTime(), Waypoint::time();
static Duration Chronicle::Facade::elapsedTimeSince ( Time  time)
static

Returns the elapsed amount of time since time.

See Also
currentTime(), Waypoint::time(), Waypoint::setDuration()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::initialize ( )
static

Initializes the Chronicle facility.

Note
You must call this method before invoking other methods. If the Facade is already initialized, calling this method has no effect.
Warning
You must call cleanup() before the process exits.
Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
isInitialized()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::isCapturePaused ( )
static

Queries the capture paused state.

Returns
true if there is a capture in progress and if it is paused, otherwise false.
See Also
pauseCapture(), isCapturing()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::isCapturing ( )
static

Queries the capture state.

Returns
true if a capture is in progress, otherwise false.
See Also
startCapture(), isCapturePaused()
static bool Chronicle::Facade::isInitialized ( )
static

Queries the intialized state.

Returns
true if the Facade has been initialized, otherwise false.
See Also
initialize(), cleanup()

static

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also

static

Opens the Chronicle website in the system-default web browser.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
openFAQ()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::pauseCapture ( )
static

Pauses the capture in progress.

If there is no capture in progress, or the capture is already paused, calling this method has no effect. To resume the capture, call the resumeCapture() method.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
isCapturing(), isCapturePaused(), canPauseCapture()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::removeObserver ( FacadeObserver *  observer)
static

Removes the specified observer.

Has no effect if the observer is not in the collection.

Parameters
observerA pointer to the observer instance which to remove.
Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
addObserver()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::resumeCapture ( )
static

Resumes the paused capture in progress.

If there is no capture in progress, or the capture is not paused, calling this method has no effect.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
isCapturing(), isCapturePaused(), canResumeCapture()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::showUtility ( )
static

Shows the Chronicle utility's main window.

The utility is made the frontmost application.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
static Error Chronicle::Facade::startCapture ( )
static

Starts the capture.

If a capture is already in progress, calling this method has no effect. To stop the capture, call the stopCapture() method. To pause the capture, call the pauseCapture() method. To resume a paused capture, call the resumeCapture() method.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
isCapturing(), canStartCapture()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::stopCapture ( )
static

Stops the capture in progress.

If there is no capture in progress, calling this method has no effect.

Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
isCapturing(), canStopCapture()
static Error Chronicle::Facade::waypointReached ( Waypoint *  waypoint)
static

Reports that the specified waypoint has been reached.

The waypoint will be recorded in the Chronicle metadata stream.

Takes ownership of the specified waypoint, regardless of success. Do not attempt to access the waypoint upon return (it may already have been destroyed).

Parameters
waypointA pointer to the waypoint to record.
Returns
Chronicle::NoError if successful, otherwise the error code.
See Also
createWaypoint()
